<DataSelect
    items={ITEMS.map((item, index) => {
        return {
            ...item,
            palette:
                index % 5 === 0
                    ? "negative"
                    : item.palette,
        };
    })}
    logic_name="dataselect-item-palette"
    logic_state="alabama"
    placeholder="Select a US State..."
/>
snippets.title: DataSelect Item Palette

data.text:
DataSelect NOTE : Introduced feature in v0.6.2. DataSelect uses various built-in Components to render a list of selectable options into a hovering box that is highly customizable, while supporting working in normal HTML forms. Imports Multiple You can allow the user to select multiple items via the multiple property. Logic State You can control which items are already selected via the logic_state property. Searching WARNING : This feature is only available in Javascript-enabled clients. DataTable includes a bottom left search box which allows users to filter rows based on the input. You can customize the default via the searching property. Maximum You can control the maximum amount of items selectable by the user via the max property. Palette You can change the color palette of the inner TextInput via the palette property.
DEFAULT
ACCENT
NEUTRAL
DARK
LIGHT
ALERT
AFFIRMATIVE
INFORMATIVE
NEGATIVE
Sizing You can change the sizing of the inner TextInput via the sizing property.
DEFAULT
NANO
TINY
SMALL
MEDIUM
LARGE
HUGE
MASSIVE
Item Disabled You can disable individual inner Check / Radio Components via the items.T[].disabled property member. { return {...item, disabled: index % 5 === 0}; })} logic_name="dataselect-item-disabled" placeholder="Select a US State..." /> Item Palette You can change the color palette of individual inner Check / Radio Components via the items.T[].palette property member. { return { ...item, palette: index % 5 === 0 ? "negative" : item.palette, }; })} logic_name="dataselect-item-palette" logic_state="alabama" placeholder="Select a US State..." />

DataSelect.name: items
DataSelect.description: Sets the options displayed to the user.
types: {disabled?: boolean, id: string, palette?: string, text: string, value?: string}

DataSelect.name: max
DataSelect.description: Controls how many multiple choices a user can select when enabled.

DataSelect.name: multiple
DataSelect.description: Controls whether multiple options can be selected by the user.

DataSelect.name: logic_name
DataSelect.description: Controls the form name that prefixes all option values.

DataSelect.name: logic_state
DataSelect.description: Controls which options are selected by their T.value, or T.id if T.value is not specified.

DataSelect.name: placeholder
DataSelect.description: Alters displayed text while closed or if no options are selected.

DataSelect.name: searching
DataSelect.description: Controls the current searching filter in the inner TextInput value.

DataSelect.name: searching_algorithm
DataSelect.description: Allows implementing of custom search filtering.

DataSelect.name: palette
DataSelect.description: Alters the color palette of the inner TextInput Component.

DataSelect.name: sizing
DataSelect.description: Alters the sizing of the innerTextInput Component.

DataSelect.name: default
DataSelect.description: Used for customizing how each item's text is rendered.

Imports

<script>
    import {DataSelect} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

Searching

WARNING: This feature is only available in Javascript-enabled clients.

DataTable includes a bottom left search box which allows users to filter rows based on the input. You can customize the default via the searching property.

        {text: "Wisconsin", id: "wisconsin"},
        {text: "Wyoming", id: "wyoming"},
    ];
</script>

<DataSelect
    items={ITEMS}
    logic_name="dataselect-max-one"
    placeholder="Select one (1) US State..."
    max={1}
    multiple
/>

<DataSelect
    items={ITEMS}
    logic_name="dataselect-max-five"
    placeholder="Select five (5) US States..."
    max={5}
    multiple
/>
